[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The X-38 Fault Tolerant System (FTS) defines requirements for spacecraft fault detection, isolation, and recovery to ensure mission reliability.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: FTS enables autonomous fault handling for navigation, propulsion, and communication systems during all mission phases.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: FTS provides dashboards and control interfaces for mission operators and fault diagnostics.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: FTS operates on avionics processors and redundant computing modules.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: FTS supports API integration with simulation environments and fault analysis tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: FTS ensures secure telemetry and command transmission using space-proven protocols.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: FTS optimizes memory for real-time fault data storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: FTS remains active throughout the mission with automated recovery and post-mission diagnostics.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: FTS configures for multiple spacecraft architectures and mission profiles.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: FTS connects to ground control for predictive maintenance.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 MISSING-TAG2: FTS integrates with spacecraft telemetry, propulsion modules, and ground control systems.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: FTS depends on stable telemetry links, redundant system architectures, and pre-mission fault calibration.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: FTS provides fault detection, isolation, and recovery for spacecraft systems.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: FTS requires operational flight control software, real-time health monitoring, and compliance with NASA avionics standards.
[SUBSEC] 1.9 Acronyms and Abbreviations: FDIR: Fault Detection, Isolation, and Recovery
NASA: National Aeronautics and Space Administration
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 MISSING-TAG1: Designed for mission operators, engineers, and AI-based diagnostics.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with spacecraft navigation and propulsion modules.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall interface with ground control for fault telemetry.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall detect faults in propulsion, navigation, and communication modules (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall recover faults within 2 seconds (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide intuitive dashboards for fault analysis.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall support multilingual interfaces for global operations.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store fault logs and recovery actions.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall support real-time updates and role-based access.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with ISO 26262 for functional safety and meet NASA flight system standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall adhere to modular architecture principles.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall scale for high-fault scenarios and log critical actions for auditing purposes.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process fault events within 1 second.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support 500 concurrent fault detections.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Validates fault detection, isolation, and recovery through real-time testing and compliance with ISO 26262.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, training guides, and compliance documentation.
[SEC] 5. References: NASA mission guidelines, ISO 26262 standards, FTS design documentation.
